{"abstract": "From AAA to bad junk, in two easy steps", "web_url": "https://economix.blogs.nytimes.com/2007/09/12/the-vanishing-rating/", "snippet": "From AAA to bad junk, in two easy steps", "lead_paragraph": "Three weeks ago, something called \u201cvariable leveraged super senior certificates\u201d issued by Foraois Funding Limited was rated Triple A by both Moody\u2019s and Standard & Poor\u2019s. {"abstract": "The Federal Reserve announced plans today to take some of the mystery out of its policy-making.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2007/11/14/business/15fed-web.html", "snippet": "The Federal Reserve announced plans today to take some of the mystery out of its policy-making.", "lead_paragraph": "WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 \u2014 The Federal Reserve announced plans today to take some of the mystery out of its policy-making, saying it will disclose more information about its economic forecasts \u2014 and also, implicitly, about its objectives for growth and inflation. {"abstract": "The corporate love of buying back stock \u2014 which Wall Street encourages as much as it can \u2014 reached new heights late last year. Standard & Poor\u2019s, which has been tracking buyback data for the S.&P. 500 since 1998, reports that in the fourth quarter of last year, companies in the index had net reported profits of $68 billion \u2014 and spent $141 billion buying back stock. That was the first quarter in which the companies managed to spend double their net income in buybacks. The third quarter of 2007 had been the first time that buybacks exceeded profits for the companies.", "web_url": "https://economix.blogs.nytimes.com/2008/04/07/profits-plunge-buybacks-dont/", "snippet": "", "lead_paragraph": "The corporate love of buying back stock \u2014 which Wall Street encourages as much as it can \u2014 reached new heights late last year. {"abstract": "The banking giant\u2019s chief isn\u2019t known for making good deals, but this one\u2019s a killer.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2008/12/03/business/economy/03views.html", "snippet": "The banking giant\u2019s chief isn\u2019t known for making good deals, but this one\u2019s a killer.", "lead_paragraph": "Vikram Pandit isn\u2019t known for his deal-making on behalf of Citigroup shareholders. Though he sold the bank his hedge fund, Old Lane, near the top of the market, the Citigroup chief executive was beaten by Wells Fargo in the battle for Wachovia two months ago. {"abstract": "The warrant valuations matter; if banks are solid enough to pay back their bailout loans and buy back the warrants, it is appropriate for the Treasury to negotiate hard on price.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2009/07/10/business/10views.html", "snippet": "The warrant valuations matter; if banks are solid enough to pay back their bailout loans and buy back the warrants, it is appropriate for the Treasury to negotiate hard on price.", "lead_paragraph": "At least Timothy F. Geithner, the Treasury secretary, learns from his mistakes. The government sold warrants that came attached to loans under the Troubled Asset Relief Program too cheaply to Old National, the first bank to buy them back. Since then, the Treasury has achieved prices much closer to realistic estimates of market value. Good thing too, with the biggest banks\u2019 warrants still outstanding.", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [{"rank": 0, "subtype": "thumbnail", "caption": null, "credit": null, "type": "image", "url": "images/2009/07/10/business/10views.75.jpg", "height": 75, "width": 75, "subType": "thumbnail", "crop_name": "thumbStandard", "legacy": {"thumbnail": "images/2009/07/10/business/10views.75.jpg", "thumbnailwidth": 75, "thumbnailheight": 75}}], "headline": {"main": "Treasury Drives a Hard Bargain", "kicker": "Breakingviews.com", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Treasury Drives a Hard Bargain", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Regulation and Deregulation of Industry", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Geithner, Timothy F", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Banks and Banking", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Obama Financial Stability Plan", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Bair, Sheila C", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Federal Deposit Insurance Corp", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Treasury Department", "rank": 7, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Pandit, Vikram S", "rank": 8, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2009-07-10T00:02:06+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "", "person": [], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News Analysis", "_id": "nyt://article/192172d4-9b1d-54d4-961d-3a559517325f", "word_count": 735, "uri": "nyt://article/192172d4-9b1d-54d4-961d-3a559517325f"}

{"abstract": "Ben S. Bernanke\u2019s remarks came as he awaited confirmation for a second term as Fed chairman and as he sought greater authority from Congress.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2010/01/04/business/economy/04fed.html", "snippet": "Ben S. {"abstract": "Mr. Sayle was a legend within the clan of globetrotting journalists, shrewd enough to locate a defected British spy, adventurous enough to track Che Guevara in Bolivian jungles.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2010/09/27/business/media/27sayle.html", "snippet": "Mr. Sayle was a legend within the clan of globetrotting journalists, shrewd enough to locate a defected British spy, adventurous enough to track Che Guevara in Bolivian jungles.", "lead_paragraph": "Early in his tenure at The Sunday Times of London, Murray Sayle reported on the escape of an eagle from the London Zoo by following the bird around Regent\u2019s Park on a bicycle. It was a minor story in a major journalistic career, but it suggested Mr. Sayle\u2019s inventive and audacious approach to his job: he would go anywhere and get there by any means necessary.", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "12", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [{"rank": 0, "subtype": "jumbo", "caption": null, "credit": null, "type": "image", "url": "images/2010/09/27/world/sayle-obit/sayle-obit-jumbo.jpg", "height": 783, "width": 1024, "subType": "jumbo", "crop_name": "jumbo", "legacy": {}}, {"rank": 0, "subtype": "thumbnail", "caption": null, "credit": null, "type": "image", "url": "images/2010/09/27/world/sayle-obit/sayle-obit-thumbStandard.jpg", "height": 75, "width": 75, "subType": "thumbnail", "crop_name": "thumbStandard", "legacy": {"thumbnail": "images/2010/09/27/world/sayle-obit/sayle-obit-thumbStandard.jpg", "thumbnailwidth": 75, "thumbnailheight": 75}}], "headline": {"main": "Murray Sayle, Reporter and Adventurer, Is Dead at 84", "kicker": null, "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Murray Sayle, 84, Reporter and Adventurer", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Writing and Writers", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Sayle, Murray", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "News and News Media", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Deaths (Obituaries)", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2010-09-27T02:49:59+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Foreign", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Media", "byline": {"original": "By Bruce Weber", "person": [{"firstname": "Bruce", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Weber", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "Obituary (Obit)", "_id": "nyt://article/1d9c3e18-ddf0-5c01-acfb-672bf8ca32c9", "word_count": 991, "uri": "nyt://article/1d9c3e18-ddf0-5c01-acfb-672bf8ca32c9"}

{"abstract": "A statement from Viacom.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2011/01/22/business/22viacom_statement.html", "snippet": "A statement from Viacom.", "lead_paragraph": "About 90% of the 2010 compensation is long-term equity awards that align our executives\u2019 interests with those of our stockholders.\u00a0 The majority of\u00a0 2010 compensation is one-time equity grants related to the previously announced long-term extensions of employment agreements, which vest over the life of those agreements.\u00a0\u00a0 In 2010 Viacom achieved outstanding operational and financial results, including double-digit growth in operating income, adjusted net earnings and total shareholder return.\u00a0 Viacom shares appreciated 33% during calendar year 2010, versus the S&P 500 gain of 12%.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Statement from Viacom", "kicker": null, "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Viacom", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [], "pub_date": "2011-01-22T01:54:14+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "", "person": [], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "Text", "_id": "nyt://article/e41e8f65-e84c-5d93-8f77-2e85ec46155c", "word_count": 84, "uri": "nyt://article/e41e8f65-e84c-5d93-8f77-2e85ec46155c"}

{"abstract": "Vikram S. {"abstract": "A 2010 paper argued that countries with heavy debt loads tended to experience slower rates of growth. {"abstract": "The Standard & Poor\u2019s 500-stock index has more than doubled since Barack Obama took office, an accomplishment achieved by only four other presidents.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/25/business/economy/sp-has-more-than-doubled-under-obama.html", "snippet": "The Standard & Poor\u2019s 500-stock index has more than doubled since Barack Obama took office, an accomplishment achieved by only four other presidents.", "lead_paragraph": "IN the 84 years that the Standard & Poor\u2019s 500-stock index has been calculated, it doubled during the terms of only four presidents before Barack Obama\u2019s election in 2008. {"abstract": "In its defense against a Justice Department lawsuit, Standard & Poor\u2019s argues that it was improperly targeted because it lowered the credit rating on federal debt two years ago. In its defense, the company accuses the government of improperly targeting S.&P. because it lowered the credit rating on federal debt two years ago. {"abstract": "Standard & Poor\u2019s lowers Puerto Rico\u2019s debt to junk status. | Morgan Stanley reaches a $1.25 billion mortgage settlement with the F.H.F.A. | Microsoft names a new chief executive. | The Deal Professor discusses Herbalife\u2019s volatile stock price.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/02/05/morning-agenda-a-debt-downgrade-for-puerto-rico/", "snippet": "Standard & Poor\u2019s lowers Puerto Rico\u2019s debt to junk status. | Morgan Stanley reaches a $1.25 billion mortgage settlement with the F.H.F.A. | Microsoft names a new chief executive. | The Deal Professor discusses Herbalife\u2019s volatile stock price.", "lead_paragraph": "Standard & Poor\u2019s lowered the debt of Puerto Rico to junk status on Tuesday, sending shock waves through the investor community, which has long enjoyed the tax-exempt interest generated by the island\u2019s municipal bonds. {"abstract": "Mr. Amos pushed the company to market its insurance policies at companies, not door to door.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2014/07/04/business/paul-s-amos-a-co-founder-of-aflac-insurance-dies-at-88.html", "snippet": "Mr. Amos pushed the company to market its insurance policies at companies, not door to door.", "lead_paragraph": "Paul S. combine.", "lead_paragraph": " WHAT S.&P.\u2019S SETTLEMENT MEANS | Standard & Poor\u2019s $1.37 billion settlement with prosecutors, announced on Tuesday, will settle an array of government lawsuits {"abstract": "A National Weather Service flood forecaster in Ohio faced federal economic espionage charges, until her case was dropped as abruptly as it had upended her life.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/05/10/business/accused-of-spying-for-china-until-she-wasnt.html", "snippet": "A National Weather Service flood forecaster in Ohio faced federal economic espionage charges, until her case was dropped as abruptly as it had upended her life.", "lead_paragraph": "On Monday, Oct. 20, 2014, Sherry Chen drove, as usual, to her office at the National Weather Service in Wilmington, Ohio, where she forecast flood threats along the Ohio River. She was a bit jet-lagged, having returned a few days earlier from a visit to China. But as she headed to her desk, she says, she had no reason to think it was anything other than an ordinary day. Then her boss summoned her. {"abstract": "Two vacancies give the regulator a chance to add market expertise. Critics may gripe about the revolving door, but it pays to know how the financial world works.", "lead_paragraph": "The Securities and Exchange Commission will soon have two top vacancies, and a Wall Street pedigree would be a plus for new watchdogs. {"abstract": "Jana Partners is ready to restructure ConAgra\u2019s board and there may be some appetite for the company\u2019s myriad brands.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/06/20/business/dealbook/with-an-activist-investor-conagra-is-primed-to-be-carved-up.html", "snippet": "Jana Partners is ready to restructure ConAgra\u2019s board and there may be some appetite for the company\u2019s myriad brands.", "lead_paragraph": "ConAgra Foods\u2019 smorgasbord is ready to carve. The conglomerate\u2019s $6.8 billion acquisition of Ralcorp in 2013 left a bad taste with shareholders. The activist investor Jana Partners is ready to shake up the board. ConAgra\u2019s myriad brands probably fit better elsewhere. The question is how to slice it.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "With an Activist Investor, ConAgra Is Primed to Be Carved Up", "kicker": "Breakingviews", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "ConAgra Foods Inc", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Jana Partners LLC", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Rodkin, Gary", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Connolly, Sean", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Rosenstein, Barry S", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2015-06-20T00:02:38+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "DealBook", "byline": {"original": "By Kevin Allison", "person": [{"firstname": "Kevin", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Allison", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/6bdf9755-7d53-5555-96cd-ffde2f861f42", "word_count": 369, "uri": "nyt://article/6bdf9755-7d53-5555-96cd-ffde2f861f42"}

{"abstract": "Economic events during formative years might exert an outsize influence on how policy makers see the world. That\u2019s an argument for studying history.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/14/upshot/which-fed-leaders-fear-inflation-look-at-when-they-grew-up.html", "snippet": "Economic events during formative years might exert an outsize influence on how policy makers see the world. That\u2019s an argument for studying history.", "lead_paragraph": "If you are an 18-year-old college freshman in the United States, inflation in your lifetime has averaged less than 2 percent. {"abstract": "The Justice Department asked the Supreme Court to review an insider trading case, but an S.E.C. administrative judge might have undercut its argument.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/17/business/dealbook/sec-judge-may-have-weakened-justice-dept-stance-in-insider-trading-case.html", "snippet": "The Justice Department asked the Supreme Court to review an insider trading case, but an S.E.C. administrative judge might have undercut its argument.", "lead_paragraph": "The appeals court decision in United States v. Newman that reversed the convictions of two hedge fund managers caused the Justice Department to take the rare step of asking the Supreme Court to overturn what it called the \u201cstark and overt departure from this court\u2019s definition of insider trading.\u201d But an opinion issued on Monday by one of the Securities and Exchange Commission\u2019s internal judges might have undercut that argument when it found that the Newman case did not work much of a change in the law.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "S.E.C. {"abstract": "The Federal Reserve\u2019s decisions may have inflated the price of financial assets, but Ben Bernanke says they kept a bad financial situation from getting worse.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/12/business/dealbook/a-debate-with-bernanke-over-the-feds-easy-money-policies.html", "snippet": "The Federal Reserve\u2019s decisions may have inflated the price of financial assets, but Ben Bernanke says they kept a bad financial situation from getting worse.", "lead_paragraph": "By the end of our recent conversation, Ben S. Bernanke, the former chairman of the Federal Reserve, and I had a gentleman\u2019s bet. I believe the easy money policies he pushed for and put in place while serving as Fed chairman starting in 2008 (and that remain in place under his successor, Janet L. Yellen) will lead inevitably to a near-term financial crisis; he thinks that idea is beyond ridiculous.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "A Debate With Bernanke Over the Fed\u2019s Easy Money Policies", "kicker": "Street Scene", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "United States Economy", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Quantitative Easing", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Federal Reserve System", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Bernanke, Ben S", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2015-11-11T18:07:24+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "DealBook", "byline": {"original": "By William D. {"abstract": "The overturning of a previous conviction in an insider trading case will test the S.E.C.\u2019s efforts in two similar cases.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/01/05/business/dealbook/in-cohen-and-ibm-insider-trading-cases-challenges-for-the-sec.html", "snippet": "The overturning of a previous conviction in an insider trading case will test the S.E.C.\u2019s efforts in two similar cases.", "lead_paragraph": "The government files insider trading charges with much fanfare, declaring that the traders will be brought to justice and investors protected.
